Key Match Events: Mohamed Marhoon scored a stunning 35-yard freekick in the 15th minute to give Bahrain the lead.
Ragnar Oratmangoen equalized for Indonesia in first-half stoppage time.
Rafael Struick scored a sublime curling effort to give Indonesia a 2-1 lead.
Mohamed Marhoon scored his second goal in the 99th minute to equalize for Bahrain.
Post-Match Reflections: Indonesia were disappointed and furious about the extended added time which led to Bahrain's equalizer.
An Indonesia official was shown a red card amid the chaotic scenes after the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indonesia continued their unbeaten start to the third round of Asian qualifiers for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.
Indonesia's next game is against China, who have lost all three outings thus far.
